question_text: During a sprint retrospective, you are conducting a Five Whys activity to unearth underlying causes to some of the issues. Surprisingly, after the forth "Why?" you all seem to be agreeing on the identified root cause. What needs to be done?

answers.choice: There is nothing wrong with this—root causes can be identified earlier than the fifth "Why".
There is something wrong about your assumptions-engage the product owner.
There is something wrong with your approach—restart the activity.

question_text: An Agile team has recently been assigned to design and deploy an ERP system for an external organization. During the project kick-off meeting, the team stressed the flow of value through rapid feature delivery to the customer. All of the following are the benefits of this mindset except:

answers.choice: Teams waste much less time because they multi-task.
People are more likely to collaborate.
Teams deliver earlier return on investment through rapid feature delivery.

question_text: Agile's approach to project management is more suitable for projects that involve:

answers.choice: The average length of a learning cycle
Procedures that have proven successful on past projects.
Low level of execution uncertainty and risk.

question_text: When your team refers to their cycle time, what do they mean?

answers.choice: The project duration, from initiation to closure
The average length of a learning cycle
The iterative cycle, from planning to testing
The time required to build a work item, from design to acceptance

question_text: Your team members are arguing about how much detail to include in a wireframe they're creating to help the product owner understand how her new website will look and function. What approach would agile recommend?

answers.choice: Include every detail that the team knows about now, so the customer can pre-approve it.
Include as little detail as possible so the conversation doesn't get bogged down in arguments about technical issues.
Include just enough detail to show what done" will look like and get buy-in on the team's approach."
Include just enough detail for the customer to find any missing features when she tries it out.

question_text: What will your team aim to do during an retrospective?

answers.choice: Simplify the design and refactor the code
Gather feedback and conduct learning cycles
Inspect and improve the team's practices and processes

question_text: Mike is the chief programmer on a software development project. He has been asked to prepare some compliance documentation for the upcoming ISO audit. Mike somehow managed to expand the scope of the programming work so that it filled almost all of his time and left him with the bare minimum of time to prepare for the audit. This behavior is commonly known as:
What wouldn't be considered an example of a review on an agile project?
Which of the following is a prime responsibility of a servant-leader in an Agile organization?

answers.choice: Designing the rewards and penalties program.
Facilitate team's discovery and definition of Agile.

question_text: Your team is using a five-point scale to rank the probability and impact of each risk from 1 (low) to 5 (high). When you multiply these two numbers together for a given risk, what do you get?
Which of the following tasks is generally recommended to be performed prior to starting an iteration?

answers.choice: Developing a precise story development schedule.
Establishing a formal change control process.
Identification of the conditions of satisfaction for the user stories.

question_text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the attitude of Agile teams towards changing requirements?

answers.choice: Agile teams do not welcome change but not changing requirements.
Agile teams welcome changing requirements during the start of the project.
Agile teams welcome changing requirements during project planning.
Agile teams welcome changing requirements, even late in development.

question_text: Which of the following statements regarding Agile approaches is correct?

answers.choice: An Agile approach can be developed from scratch as long as it adheres to the mindset, values and principles of the Agile Manifesto.
Agile approaches mandate the use of a Kanban board to manage the team's work in progress.
Agile approaches mandate preparing and refining a product backlog and then developing it in small batches.
Agile approaches mandate the use of daily standups and end of sprint retrospectives.

question_text: When a team starts using agile methods, what is one of the changes they will need to focus on?

An Agile team is currently working on a complex ERP customization and deployment project. The team is currently facing an issue with deploying a couple of features as the recipient department is not yet ready for the changeover. Which Scrum role is responsible for removing this impediment?
The time-box for the current iteration has expired. All of the following activities must now be organized except:
You are managing a complex enterprise-wide project. If the project completion date has been fixed, how would you reflect the project uncertainty in the release plan?

answers.choice: Reverting back to traditional project management approaches.
Pushing the team to crash the project and shifting the focus from quality control.
Classifying the requested features as "must have" and "good to have".
Developing the release plan in a way that 90% or more of the team effort is spent on development.

question_text: Your team has just completed the first sprint on the project and is preparing for a demonstration of the completed features. Who do you need to invite for the demonstration to accept or reject the features?
If an Agile project's SPI is greater than the project's CPI, and the CPI is less than 1.0, what can you infer about the project's schedule performance?

answers.choice: This cannot be determined with the given data.
The project is ahead of schedule.
Agile projects do not have Earned Value measurements.

question_text: When it is time to sit down and refine the backlog for your Scrum project, who is in the room?

answers.choice: The customer, the team coach, and the delivery team
The development team and the product owner
The sponsor, the product owner, and the ScrumMaster
The development team and any other interested stakeholders

question_text: What enables an Agile team to deliver successful projects?
Your team completed six stories in iteration 3, four stories in iteration 4, and five stories in iteration 5. As team coach, what should you do about this?

answers.choice: Work on your own skills at removing impediments.
Nothing. There is no problem here.
Engage the team to address the problem.

question_text: Your team holds regular sprint reviews and sprint retrospectives with the product owner. Which agile methodology are you following?
Which of these descriptions could be referring to a minimal marketable feature?

answers.choice: A bicycle without a front wheel

question_text: Why is communication more difficult on a distributed agile team?

answers.choice: People prefer not to get up and walk over to the other person's desk.
People in different offices can't see each other work.
People in different parts of the world don't speak the same language.
People at different work sites can't communicate face to face.

question_text: You are helping a software development team transition from traditional to Agile approaches. You tell the team that the single most important attribute of any product or feature is:

answers.choice: The velocity at which the team takes on the development of that product or feature.
The time required to deliver the product or feature.
The value customers associate with that product or feature.
The ideal days estimated to develop the minimum viable product or feature.

question_text: Which of the following is LEAST helpful in estimating the financial return on a theme?

answers.choice: Estimating the timing of sales increases.
Estimating the average value of a sale.

question_text: Which of the following Agile tools is used to visualize the progress of work items through a project?
What could your team use to move beyond their automatic assumptions and identify the real causes of a problem?
You are your Agile team are currently decomposing the stories into smaller stories and tasks to be completed in the next three weeks. Which Agile planning meeting is this?
Ideally all Agile team members should be 100% dedicated to the project. While this condition is ideal, it sometimes cannot be met. What is the key problem when team members are not 100% dedicated?

answers.choice: Multi-tasking and task switching impacts the team's ability to delivery consistently.
It creates a conflict of interest.
Team cannot focus on high-value requirements.
Individual throughput per hour is reduced.

question_text: How do agile teams use personas?

answers.choice: Personas define the roles and responsibilities of the team members.
Personas help a team understand and stay focused on the people who will use the system.
Personas are virtual avatars that can stand in for team members who are working off-site.
Personas can be used as replacements for traditional requirements.

question_text: You and your sponsor are in an important meeting to select a project from among other projects having similar investments. In this context, you select the project with:

Please refer to the Decision Tree given below which shows the analysis of profit/loss for the two alternatives (i.e., build or buy). Which, out of the two alternatives of build or buy, should the project manager recommend?

answers.choice: Sensitivity analysis before making a build/buy decision

question_text: Organizations performing projects will usually divide each project into several project phases to improve management control. This also provides links to the ongoing operations of the performing organization. Collectively, project phases are also called:
You are the project manager in the public works department, which awards contracts for constructing roads. Before selecting the sellers, you must advertise in local newspapers. This is an example of:

You have recently taken over as project manager. In your initial meeting, you first notice that there is too much conflict among the project team members, which harms productivity and working relationships. In this context, which of the following would NOT be a technique you would use to reduce conflict in your team?

answers.choice: Avoid differences of opinion among team members

question_text: You work for a company which executes heavy engineering contracts. While performing risk response planning for your project, you determine a risk that there is a "Possibility of getting new orders in the future which are beyond the current capacity of our production facilities." What should you do?

answers.choice: Classify this as a threat and create workaround plans.
Classify this as a weakness and transfer it to another company.
Classify this as an opportunity and exploit the opportunity.
Classify this as strength and create a fallback plan.

question_text: Your project is being carried out under a contract. There have been some changes in the project scope and you want to determine the cause of variance with respect to the scope baseline. This will help you decide whether corrective action is required. This should be done as part of:
In your project, you use control charts to monitor cost and schedule variances. In this context, you would call the process “out of control” in all the following EXCEPT:

answers.choice: Seven consecutive points on the same side of the mean

question_text: You are the project manager of a manufacturing firm that produces machine parts required in automobiles. During a review, you discover some design requirements are not taken into account. You should:

answers.choice: Inform your project sponsor that the project may be delayed because of the missed requirements.
Go ahead with production because incorporating the requirements may delay the schedule.
Escalate this issue to your senior management.
Instruct your team to incorporate the requirements and do an analysis to figure out the potential impact.

question_text: You are a project manager in an IT consultancy firm, where you notice that data expands to fill the space available for storage. You have to constantly keep upgrading your data storage capacity and processor speed. This is an example of:
Which risk response technique is being used in these situations? Match each technique to its scenario :

answers.choice: You hear that it's going to rain for the first three days of your trip, so you bring waterproof tents and indoor projects for the team to work in the meantime
There's a high probability of water damaged to some of your equipment, so you buy insurance to avoid loses

question_text: Your company is involved in the activity of identifying and documenting the norms for rating or scoring proposals at the organization level. From a project management perspective, this can be referred to as:
As a project manager, you are in the process of making information promptly available to project stakeholders. Which of the following tools should you use?

At the beginning of a project, it may be necessary for senior stakeholders to be highly engaged in order to clear away any obstacles to success. Once these have been successfully removed, it may be sufficient for senior stakeholders to change their level of engagement from leading to supportive, and other stakeholders, such as end users, may become more important. The level of engagement can be documented using:
After collecting requirements, one of your tasks as a project manager is to prepare a scope statement for your project. The scope statement provides:

answers.choice: Documentation of how the project scope will be managed and how scope changes will be integrated into the project.
A common understanding of the project scope among the stakeholders. and a documented basis for making future project decisions
Authorization to the project manager for using organizational resources for project activities.

question_text: You are the project manager of a complicated construction project, which involves building highways in the state of North Carolina. You have several groups working with you in the project. To plan resources for this project and determine connection between activities you should preferably use:
A contract is legally binding in all the following cases EXCEPT:

answers.choice: The seller is not able to produce goods as part of the contract.
The contract violates the law of the land
The buyer is not able to satisfy financial obligations.
The signatory to the contract leaves the company.

question_text: You have calculated the projected cost performance that must be achieved on the remaining work to meet a specified goal. This projected cost performance is also known as:

Project Risk Management helps in maximizing the probability and impact of positive events, and minimizing the probability and impact of negative events in the project. In this context, Plan Risk Responses process:

answers.choice: Helps in defining how to conduct the risk management activities
Develops procedures and techniques to enhance opportunities and to reduce threats to project objectives
Determines which risks may affect the project and documents their characteristics
Monitors residual risks, identifies new risks, and evaluates risk process effectiveness

question_text: Items at the lowest level of a Work Breakdown Structure are also called:

answers.choice: WBS, Work Components, Work Packages or WBS Dictionaries - depending on the context in which the term is used

question_text: As a project manager, you would like to develop a procurement statement of work. This would require (select the best answer):
In your project, you intend to identify and document interactivity dependencies. Which of the following will not be used as an input for this purpose?

The CEO of ABC bank is concerned about the increase in "call answering time" in the bank`s call center (i.e., customers have to wait longer for their calls to be answered by an operator). She wants to improve call center processes to decrease the "call answering time." What should the CEO do to address the situation?

answers.choice: Move to a projectized organizational structure
Assign a very competent project manager to manage activities in the call center

question_text: Please refer to the following diagram: You know that current variances are atypical, i.e., similar variances will not occur in future. What is the cost performance index (CPI) for the project?

In your project, there is a necessity to use a certain technology that will save you time and money, but the required technology is patented. After extensive research, you determine that use of any other technology is not feasible. In this context, you should:

answers.choice: Try to develop another technology in-house through extensive research.
Pay the royalty and obtain written permission of the owner to use the technology.
Use the technology with little modifications to avoid patent related issues.
Use the required technology and pay the royalties later.

question_text: In your project, you want to define variance thresholds at the designated time points over the duration of a project. So, you should use:
What are the basic types of phase-to-phase relationships?
Implementation of which one of the following strategies results in a lose-lose situation?
You realize that you are not able to concentrate on your work due to an actual or potential conflict of interest situation. Which out of the following should you NOT do, in this context?

answers.choice: Seek stakeholders' consent to proceed further
Engage in decision-making activities related to the conflict of interest situation
Disclose the facts to the affected stakeholders

question_text: If there is a fire, the risk response plan developed is to use a fire extinguisher. If the fire extinguisher cannot take care of the fire, you call in a fire engine – calling in the fire engine is an example of:
A project manager wants to update a project management plan. You suggest that the updated project management plan should include:

answers.choice: Performance reports and enterprise environmental factors
Final product, service, or result transition and organizational process assets updates
Quality management plan, cost, and schedule baselines
Expert judgment and change control meetings

Enter the correct number (only) in the following text box:

answers.choice: Plan Quality Management, Plan Procurement Management, Plan Risk Responses, Control Costs
Manage Quality, Develop Team, Manage Communications, Plan Risk Management
Validate Scope, Control Quality, Control Schedule, Control Costs
Define Scope, Develop Schedule, Plan Risk Management, Plan Communications Management

question_text: You are reaching project completion, and want to understand whether your project was successful. In this context, for a project to be successful, what is the primary requirement?

answers.choice: Meeting the cost and schedule estimates
Satisfying the requirements of the project sponsor

question_text: Just-in-time (JIT) manufacturing techniques are used by Japanese auto-companies to improve overall quality and decrease operational costs. In this context, which of the following statements related to JIT is incorrect?

answers.choice: It eliminates costs related to material handling, storage, paperwork, and inspection.
It emphasizes short term relationships with suppliers.
It reduces inventory to minimal level.

question_text: As a project manager, you want to have an appropriate recognition and rewards system to encourage better performance and reinforce desired behavior. All the following statements on recognition and rewards system are correct EXCEPT:

answers.choice: Recognition and reward systems should promote or reinforce desired behavior.
Recognition and rewards should consider cultural differences.
Recognition for team members who work extra hours on the weekends.
Electing the team member of the month should be discouraged because it can hurt team cohesiveness.

question_text: In your project, you want to ensure that each requirement adds business value by linking it to the business and project objectives. This also provides a means to track requirements throughout the project life cycle, helping to ensure that requirements approved in the requirements documentation are delivered at the end of the project. A document that you can use is:

answers.choice: Identify specific activities that need to be performed to produce project deliverables
Aggregate estimated costs of individual activities through cost budgeting
Prepare a detailed project scope statement

question_text: You are constructing a railway track, which will pass through a less populated area. All necessary government and regulatory approvals have been obtained for the project. You are aware that due to the motion of the train, there is a very low probability of houses in the vicinity developing cracks. In this context, you should:

answers.choice: Do nothing, since the probability of adverse consequences is minimal
Inform the local people about the possibility of damage to their houses and preventive measures
Teach people how to rebuild their houses with concrete

question_text: Which of the following projects described below will you select?

answers.choice: Project A with opportunity cost of $ 100,000 and investment of $ 1,000,000.
Project B with opportunity cost of $ 200,000 and investment of $ 500,000.
Project C with opportunity cost of $ 300,000 and investment of $ 3,500,000.
Cannot be determined from the above options.

question_text: While performing Control Scope process, you ensure that all requested changes and recommended corrective actions are processed through the Perform Integrated Change Control process. In this context, if a change is requested, what should the project manager do FIRST?

answers.choice: Discuss the change in the next status review meeting
Try to find out the financial implication of the change
Evaluate the change and try to prevent unwarranted changes

Inform the senior management about those team members.

answers.choice: You should talk with the team member to understand why he was late and discuss how to prevent similar situations in future
You should raise this issue with your manager and ask for ways to avoid similar problems in future

In a cost reimbursable contract, the risk of the seller is low.
In a time and material contract, the risk of the buyer is low.

question_text: In your project, you have created a list of identified risks and potential responses. You should document this information in:

answers.choice: Getting validation from the U.S. FDA that nuclear waste is dangerous
Determining that the contract violates applicable law

answers.choice: Stakeholders` responsibilities remain stable throughout the project life cycle.
Stakeholders may exert influence over the project.

Sponsor creates the project management plan based on inputs from the project manager and the functional manager.
Project manager creates the project management plan based on inputs from the team.

question_text: You are nearing project completion and want to get feedback about the overall project performance. From project management perspective, a project is considered to be successful when:

answers.choice: The project manager announces the completion of the project.
The sponsor announces the completion of the project.
The customer is happy because you provided additional features which she had not expected.

question_text: Improving competencies and interaction of team members helps in improving project performance. This activity is performed as part of which project process group?

answers.choice: Ask the customer for additional funding to implement the requirement

question_text: As part of your project, you were involved with improving the competencies and interaction of team members to enhance project performance. What should you do next?

question_text: During Identify Stakeholder process, the project manager identifies all people or organizations impacted by the project, and documents relevant information regarding their interests, involvement, and impact on project success. answers.choice: Stakeholders exert influence over the project and its deliverables
It is critical for project success to identify the stakeholders early in the project

question_text: When your project is nearing completion, the customer requests you to include an additional feature in the final product. You realize that this feature was discussed with the project sponsor in an earlier meeting and he was against having this feature. What will be the BEST course of action?

answers.choice: Include the feature, as it will improve customer satisfaction
Include the feature --otherwise, the project will not be accepted by the customer
Talk with the sponsor on the benefits of having this feature
Decline the customer request and advise her to create a change request

question_text: Your finance manager informs you that, for accounting purposes, your company assets depreciate by the same amount every year. This type of depreciation is known as

There is clarity about the business needs, high-level project description, and product requirements that the project is to address. A summary budget has also been approved. Given this information, what activity should the project manager perform FIRST?

answers.choice: Perform the work defined in the project management plan to achieve the project's objectives.
Review all change requests, approve changes, and manage changes to the deliverables, organizational process assets, project documents, and the project management plan.
Track, review, and regulate the progress to meet the project objectives defined in the project management plan.
Define, prepare, integrate, and coordinate all subsidiary plans into a project management plan.

question_text: A conflict resolution technique that emphasizes areas of agreement is also called:

You have reached the end of your project, but you are worried that the fee that will be paid to you will be based on the subjective determination of your performance by the buyer. Moreover, the contract clause does not allow for appeals in courts of law. This is a feature of:

answers.choice: Fixed Price with Economic Price Adjustment contract
Illegal contract type because all contract terms can be litigated in courts

question_text: You are monitoring and controlling your project, when your team members ask for some corrective action and preventive actions for errors. Some defects should also be handled through defect repair. You will include all this as part of:

You are the project manager of a project team that includes several new recruits. You notice that most of the team members possess "I am right mentality" and put forth their own ideas for consideration. In this context, your team is in which of the following stages of group development?
In your project, you create project documents which will help you when managing the project. Which of the following is NOT an example of project documents?
Please refer to the diagram above. Which of the following situations can this diagram represent?

answers.choice: Task X (actual work of writing) and Task Z (thinking about what to write) should be done in parallel.
Task Z (unit testing the code) should begin 7 days after finishing Task X (writing the code).
Task X and Task Z together have 7 days of slack.
Task Z (plastering the floor) should begin 7 days after beginning Task X (pouring concrete).

question_text: Select all the true statements about the activity list produced as an output from the Define Activities process:

answers.choice: The activity list should include descriptions of major activities in sufficient detail
The activity list is obtained through decomposition of work packages.
The activity list should include activity duration estimates and scope of work description for each activity
The activity list must include all activities that will be performed on the project

question_text: In your project, you use control charts to monitor cost and schedule variances. In this context, select all the situations where you would call the process “out of control” :

answers.choice: Seven consecutive points on the same side of the mean

question_text: As part of your staffing management plan, you are creating a chart to illustrate the number of hours that a person, department, or entire project team will need each week or month over the course of the project. This chart is also known as:
The activity list should include descriptions of activities. This is required to:

answers.choice: Provide a common understanding of the project scope among the project stakeholders
Ensure that the team members understand what work is to be completed
Serve as a reminder to the project manager
Help in creation of technical documentation during the project life cycle

question_text: In the Identify Risks process, you are working with your team to determine which risks may affect project performance. Which of the following information gathering techniques can you use to facilitate the process (Select the best answer)?

answers.choice: Brainstorming, cause and effect diagrams, and P&I Matrix
Delphi technique, SWOT analysis, and risk audits
SWOT analysis, Decision tree, and influence diagrams
Brainstorming, risk checklist, and root cause analysis

question_text: You are in the process of creating a project plan for the launch of a new drug. While creating the plan, your finance manager has provided some very useful insights for marketing the new drug. This shows that:

answers.choice: Every stakeholder has skills and knowledge that can be used in developing the project plan.
Finance managers usually have good knowledge about marketing activities.
Finance managers should always be involved when creating a project plan.
Finance managers and project managers should always work in tandem during project plan creation.

question_text: You are doing a quality audit for your project to identify all the gaps/shortcomings in yourproject. This is a part of:
You are managing the release of a new drug in the market. Your role is that of a:

answers.choice: Functional Manager, because you have good functional knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry
Project Manager, because you are creating a unique product within specific time schedules
Operations Manager, because you have to do several repetitive tasks
Program Manager, because you have to manage several projects to do your job effectively

question_text: Which of the following does not refer to power derived from the position of the project manager in the organization?
In your project, you prefer gantt charts over project network diagrams for the purpose of:

answers.choice: Determining the critical path of the project and start and finish dates for each activity
Making presentations to the project team and tracking schedule
Determining the critical path of the project
Determining the start and finish dates for each activity

question_text: Performance reporting involves the periodic collection and analysis of baseline versus actual data to understand and communicate the project progress and performance as well as to forecast the project results. Performance reports may include which of following EXCEPT?:

answers.choice: Current status of risks and issues
Summary of changes approved in the period

question_text: In your project, you are estimating schedule activity costs. You decide to use the bottom-up estimating technique. In this context, all the following statements are accurate EXCEPT that Bottom-up Estimates:

answers.choice: Is a method of estimating a component of work
Determines the cost of individual scope requirements in the scope statement
Provides detailed costs at lowest levels that are rolled up to higher levels for reporting and tracking purposes
Provide cost and accuracy, which is influenced by the size and complexity of the individual schedule activity or work package

question_text: As the project manager of an IT project, you are directing and managing the project execution. You have been looking at information related to similar projects. Which tools will you use?

answers.choice: Interpersonal skills and product development skills
Status review meetings and organization procedures
Risk management and project selection techniques

question_text: In the contract document of the project, the time schedules and deliverables in each phase are clearly stipulated. From a project management perspective, this is:

In your project, while decomposing the project work into more manageable components, you are aware of the problem of excessive decomposition. Which of the following is not the consequence of excessive decomposition?
Which of the following organization charts has a hierarchical format?

You are the project manager of an IT company. You are creating a collection and filing structure that details methods used to gather and store various types of information, and also procedures to collect and disseminate updates and corrections to the concerned stakeholders. Where will you include this information?

You have recently assumed charge of a project from another project manager. You want to know what kind of information you should provide to different stakeholders and what methods to adopt for this purpose. You will find this information in the:
You have completed the process of developing options and actions to enhance opportunities and to reduce threats to project objectives. What is your NEXT step?

answers.choice: Determine which risks may affect the project and document their characteristics
Assess the priority of identified risks using their probability of occurrence.
Define how to conduct risk management activities for a project.
Implement risk response plans, track identified risks, and monitor residual risks.

question_text: Decomposition is a critical part of Create WBS process. However, decomposition may not be possible for a deliverable or subproject if:

answers.choice: The deliverable or subproject is very complicated
The deliverable or subproject is already being produced
The deliverable or subproject will be accomplished far into the future

question_text: While managing a project for a manufacturing company, you receive a change request from the customer for a minor alteration to the product configuration. In this context, which of the following is NOT a step you would take next?

answers.choice: Evaluate the impact of the change
Reject the change request as this would change the product configuration
Seek approval from change control board

question_text: You have recently appointed a project manager to handle a critical project in your organization. You want to give her the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. Which document should you use?

You are the project manager of a software company involved in creating an anti-virus software product. You are in the execution phase of the project when you realize that a requirement was not included in the product. This is due to an omission in defining the scope baseline of the project. What should you do?

answers.choice: Add the requirements to your product and continue with execution

question_text: Recently you joined ABC bank as a project manager. Although the project is within budget and doing well, recently there have been several change requests. The outgoing project manager was using twelve project management processes during the project execution. Given this information, which of the following could be the most likely cause of frequent change requests?

answers.choice: The new project manager was appointed for a very critical project and proper training was not provided.
New methods of communication like email and SMS were not used as part of project communication management.
Very few project management processes were used by the outgoing project manager

question_text: While working on the project, you set realistic (and challenging) targets. This is because you know that if extra time is provided, "Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion." This is also referred to as:

The buyer has clearly specified that only those companies can bid for the contract that have revenues greater than $ 300 million and profitability of more than $ 30 million over the past 3 years. This can also be referred to as:
In your project, after identifying stakeholders, you want to create a Stakeholder Register. In this context, this document should not contain which of the following sets of information ?

answers.choice: Identification information (e.g. name, role in project, etc.)
Assessment information (e.g. major requirements, main expectations etc.)
Stakeholder level of engagement (e.g. level of participation, stakeholder groups etc.)

question_text: The project manager of a critical project in your company has to go on leave and you have to take up his responsibility. In the project briefing, the outgoing project manager tells you that the scope statement for the project has been documented, WBS has been created by subdividing the major project deliverables into smaller, more manageable components and an activity list has been prepared. What should you do NEXT?
According to Maslow`s hierarchy of needs, economic security is a:

You are managing a team consisting of members from four different countries; you realize that some cultural differences among your team members are hampering the progress of your project. In this context, what should you do?

answers.choice: Train your team members on project objectives.
Conduct team building activities in which most of the team members can participate actively.
Train your team members on the broad objectives of your organization.
Provide training to your team members regarding cultural diversities among different countries along with training on project objectives and the company culture.

question_text: In the Conduct Procurements process, you award a contract to the selected seller. In this context, which of the following does not describe a contract?

answers.choice: Signed off by the buyer and the seller
Cost Reimbursable, Time and Material or Fixed Price

question_text: In your project, your team is identifying which dependencies are discretionary during the process of sequencing the activities. Discretionary dependencies are sometimes referred to as:

When talking to the stakeholders to identify risk, you start with identification of strengths and weaknesses of the organization, focusing on either the project, organization, or the business area in general. This is also called:
Your project is terminated early. To investigate and document the reasons for the early termination of the project, you follow certain procedures. This is performed during:
Early termination of a contract is a special case of contract closure. This can happen because of:

In your project, you have created a Project Charter and Identified important stakeholders. Now, you want to define and document stakeholders` needs to meet the project objectives. This should be done as part of:
In PDM, which precedence relationship type is most commonly used?
Think of the information in the charter for the project, and match out what you think each of the following sections of a typical project charter is used for

answers.choice: This is a high-level description of the goals of your project.
Anything you know that the customer, stakeholder, or sponsor expects to get out of the project should go here

question_text:
You have asked your programmer to give you an estimate of how long she will take to complete a software program. She mentions that she would most probably get the job finished in 2 hours. But if she runs into some issues with doing unit-testing for the program, it could take her as long as 7 hours. On the other hand, she may be able to pick up a similar program from the organization process assets, in which case it will take her only 1 hour. What is the standard deviation? 

Enter the correct number (only) in the following text box:
Match each communication element to what it does

answers.choice: Letting the sender know that the message was received
Getting the information from one person to the other

question_text:
You are considering whether to buy or lease a machine for your heavy engineering plant. Your finance department has provided you the following data: 
The cost of buying the machine (`If you buy`) is $ 29,000 and the cost of one-time procurement and integration is $ 1000. 
The cost of leasing the machine (`If you lease`) involves $ 10,000 as down payment and $ 5,000 per month as license fee.

What is the breakeven duration after which the buying of the machine is preferable to leasing it?

answers.choice: Cannot be determined from the available data

question_text: All the following statements about a project life cycle are correct EXCEPT:

answers.choice: All project life cycles are usually identical.
The level of risk is highest at the start of the project and decreases as the project progresses.
Cost and staffing requirements usually peak during the intermediate phases.
The ability of the stakeholders to influence is highest at the start and gets progressively lower as the project continues.

question_text: Which of the following is not a major component in a contract document?
`Cost of quality` includes all costs incurred over the life of the product by investing in meeting requirements. In this context, which of the following is not a 'cost of quality'?
From a project management perspective, which of the following BEST describes quality attributes?

answers.choice: They are the quality criteria that are to be met mandatorily.
They provide a basis for judging a project`s success or failure.
They provide a basis for determining how effectively performing organization supports the project.
They are the specific characteristics for which a project`s product is designed and tested.

question_text: You would like to use decomposition for subdivision of project deliverables into smaller, more manageable components until the work and deliverables are defined to the work package level. Which of the following statements about decomposition is incorrect?

answers.choice: The project team needs to seek a balance between too little and too much in the level of WBS planning detail.
The decomposition of the upper level WBS components requires subdividing the work for each of the deliverables or subprojects into its fundamental components.
Decomposition is done as part of Create WBS process.
All deliverables have similar levels of decomposition.

question_text: You create a project charter that formally authorizes a project or a phase, and documents initial requirements that satisfy the stakeholder`s needs and expectations. In this context, which of the following will not be included in the project charter?

answers.choice: Measurable project objectives and related success criteria
Assigned project manager, responsibility and authority level

question_text: You have asked your programmer to give you an estimate of how long she will take to complete a software program. She mentions that she would most probably get the job finished in 2 hours. But if she runs into some issues with doing unit-testing for the program, it could take her as long as 7 hours. On the other hand, she may be able to pick up a similar program from the organization process assets, in which case it will take her only 1 hour. What is the standard deviation?

answers.choice: Cannot be determined from the provided information

question_text: Perform Integrated Change Control process requires coordinating changes across knowledge areas. When a proposed schedule change occurs, which of the following will least be affected?
